alert.note: Alert for Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 3:51PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Huerfano, east central Costilla and western Las Animas Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 351 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northeast of San Luis, or 17 miles southwest of Indian Creek on the southeastern Spring Burn Scar, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Huerfano, east central Costilla and western Las Animas Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft
